page.title: 08Farming
page.content: There are no large fishing vessels in the port of Holyhead.The trawlers arenot much larger than 20metres in length and are mainly concerned with inshore fishing.Most of the ships are owned by asyndicate or are a family concern.All the vessels have modern equipment,such as radar,radios,winches and power pulleys. Recently the trawler owners have felt aggrieved in that they have now to pay harbour fees.This matter has yet to be resolved asif the fees are too high then some of the fishermen could be driven out of business.
